author: djrtwo
content:
> Just to clarify ^^ This statement is true provided we do not add any other method to the deposit contract besides deposit(), right?

This is not entirely correct.
* Because rewards are issued in eth2, the balance of ETH in eth2 will very likely exceed the balance of ETH in the deposit contract so a simple withdrawal would not be sound
* Even if you had a "withdrawal" function in the deposit contract, the contract would still need to know about state of eth2 to process the withdrawals correctly. This would either require some sort of fork on eth1 to expose the eth2 stateroot/related info _OR_ would require some sort of eth2 light client to be implemented in an eth1 contract and the deposit contract be aware of it.

content: > As the `DEPOSIT_CONTRACT_ADDRESS` is a smart contract address, while there is in principle a private key attached to it, this is unknowable for everybody, including its creator. It follows that the funds once transferred to the deposit contract using the `deposit()` function are _irretrievably lost_. If we wanted to design a system to recover these funds (on any adversary event), we would need not only a fork to the Eth1 chain to make these funds available, but to develop a system to keep track on the new funds (`bETH`) obtained in the Eth2 chain, most likely light clients in Eth1. There are also a number of tax implications on a so-called _2-way bridge_ being discussed by experts as this moment that need to be taken into account.

author: eth2_gitter_bot
content: <dangerousfood> I assume `shard data chains` will be using libp2p to communicate. Is there a plan for how discovery might work for shard chains? Any pertinent links would be helpful. Thanks

author: djrtwo
content:
what do you mean discovery here?
a shard chain is part of the protocol. If you run the beacon chain, you can run any number of shard chains. To sync the shard chain or interact with others wrt the shard chain (broadcast transactions, etc), you need to find peers that are gossiping data about that shard chain. You can use libp2p's pubsub capabilities to subscribe to peers on the relevant topics. If none of your peers are on the topics, you would need to find new peers with those capabilities. The goal is to allow advertisement of this info via discv5
